Fall sports are under way in Orchard View! To be eligible to play, all athletes and coaches will abide by the following guidance:

A face covering must be worn at all times by athletes training for, practicing for, or competing in an organized sport when the athlete cannot maintain 6 feet of social distance, except for occasional and fleeting moments.

Since our athletes competing in football, soccer, or volleyball, for example, are not able to maintain 6 feet of social distance as required they would need to wear a facial covering.

Hope this background helps. Mask, or no mask, we are excited to represent the Orchard View Community in competition this Fall!

The following update is from our High School:

Attention High School Students! We are looking forward to having you back in the building tomorrow. Here are a couple tips to help the morning run more smoothly:

1. Grab and go breakfast stations will be set up at the main entrances. Grab one as you enter.

2. There will be 4 tables set up throughout the commons to get your schedule. You can go to any table to get your schedule. Please don’t crowd around the tables. Form a line and keep your distance.

3. After you get your schedule, find your locker and practice your combination. Once you get your locker open, place your backpack and other items in there.

4. Proceed to your first hour class with a writing utensil and paper to eat your breakfast and start your day!

Remember that there will be many staff members in the hallways to help, just ask. Also, please remember to keep your masks on at all times.

Looking forward to a great start!

Q. When will OVLPA students have orientation next week?
A. This will be done virtually and shared out via Facebook and linked on our website.

Q. When can we get a chromebook?
A. Chromebooks will be distributed next week during orientation provided our shipment arrives on time. Specific times per building will be shared during the orientation video.

Q. Will the new OVPLA be different than what was done last Spring?
A. YES! If you would like to preview what will be done, please visit edmentum.com. If your student is K-5th grade, please click on Calvert. If your student is 6th-12th grade, please click on Courseware.

More information will be shared during the orientation. Should you have any other questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to our new Director of Innovative Programs, Cathy Cantu: cathy.cantu@orchardview.org

Congratulations! OVHS Sophomore Nathan Sattory competed in the Regional National History Day Competition at GVSU today (March 21st). (The competition was held in a virtual format due to the Corona Pandemic) Nathan's research paper entitled, The Writer Who Destroyed an Empire: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn, was selected by NHD judges to move on to the NHD State Finals at Central Michigan University (which will be held in the same virtual format on April 8th).

The National History Day Project is a nationwide contest where students choose historical topics related to a theme & conduct research. After analyzing and interpreting their sources and drawing conclusions about their topic's significance in history, students present their work in the form of a project (choices include research papers, websites, exhibits, and documentaries). These projects then are entered into competition at the school, regional, state and national levels.

post_text: Last week Mrs. Foster's class played in a Mancala tournament. What is Mancala? Mancala is one of the oldest known games to still be widely played today. Mancala is a generic name for a family of two-player, turn-based strategy board games played with small stones, beans, or seeds and rows of holes or pits in the earth, a board, or other playing surface. The objective is usually to capture all or some set of the opponent's pieces. Versions of the game date back to the 7th century, and evidence suggests the game existed in ancient Egypt.
